intro: Babingtonia gracilis, commonly known as the slender babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, often with a slight pubescence. Babingtonia gracilis is typically found in coastal or lowland forest environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
